events.name: plusExpanded
events.description: Fires after the element has expanded.

elements.title: Accordion
elements.description: A vertically stacked list of headers that reveal or hide associated sections of content.

properties.name: persistent
properties.description: Specifies that only one accordion can be open.

events.name: plusCancel
events.description: Fires when the [Animation.cancel()](https://mdn.io/animation-cancel) method is called or when the animation enters the "`idle`" play state from another state.

events.name: plusFinish
events.description: Fires when the animation finishes playing.

events.name: plusRemove
events.description: Fires when the animation is removed (i.e., put into an `active` replace state).

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Clears all [keyframeEffects](https://mdn.io/keyframe-effect) caused by this animation and aborts its playback.

methods.name: commitStyles
methods.description: Commits the end styling state of an animation to the element being animated, even after that animation has been removed. It will cause the end styling state to be written to the element being animated, in the form of properties inside a `style` attribute.

methods.name: finish
methods.description: Seeks either end of an animation, depending on whether the animation is playing or reversing.

methods.name: persist
methods.description: Explicitly persists an animation, when it would otherwise be removed due to the browser's [Automatically removing filling animations](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation#automatically_removing_filling_animations) behavior.

methods.name: play
methods.description: Starts or resumes playing of an animation, or begins the animation again if it previously finished.

methods.name: reverse
methods.description: Reverses playback direction, stopping at the start of the animation. If the animation is finished or unplayed, it will play from end to beginning.

methods.name: updatePlaybackRate
methods.description: Sets the speed of an animation after first synchronizing its playback position.

properties.name: composite
properties.description: Determines how values are combined between this animation and other, separate animations that do not specify their own specific composite operation.

properties.name: delay
properties.description: The number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: Whether the animation runs forwards (`normal`), backwards (`reverse`), switches direction after each iteration (`alternate`), or runs backwards and switches direction after each iteration (`alternate-reverse`).

properties.name: duration
properties.description: The number of milliseconds each iteration of the animation takes to complete. Keep in mind that your animation will not run if this value is 0.

properties.name: easing
properties.description: The rate of the animation's change over time. Accepts the pre-defined values "`linear`", "`ease`", "`ease-in`", "`ease-out`", and "`ease-in-out`", or a custom "`cubic-bezier`" value like "`cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1)`".

properties.name: endDelay
properties.description: The number of milliseconds to delay after the end of an animation. This is primarily of use when sequencing animations based on the end time of another animation.

properties.name: fill
properties.description: Dictates whether the animation's effects should be reflected by the element(s) prior to playing ("`backwards`"), retained after the animation has completed playing ("`forwards`"), or `both`.

properties.name: instance
properties.description: The [Animation](https://mdn.io/api-animation) object instance.

properties.name: iterationComposite
properties.description: Determines how values build from iteration to iteration in this animation. Can be set to `accumulate` or `replace`.

properties.name: iterations
properties.description: The number of times the animation should repeat. And can also take a value of [Infinity](https://mdn.io/infinity) to make it repeat for as long as the element exists.

properties.name: iterationStart
properties.description: Describes at what point in the iteration the animation should start. 0.5 would indicate starting halfway through the first iteration for example, and with this value set, an animation with 2 iterations would end halfway through a third iteration.

properties.name: keyframes
properties.description: A [keyframes](https://mdn.io/keyframe-formats) object or `null`.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Specifies what kind of animation will play. The list of available animations is [here](/element/animation/names).

properties.name: playbackRate
properties.description: Sets the animation's playback rate.

properties.name: run
properties.description: Starts the animation.

elements.readmeContent:
# Animation

Creates an animation and applies it to the content. Powered by the [Web Animations API](https://mdn.io/web-animations-api). A wide range of animations is available [here](https://www.htmlplus.io/element/animation/names).

<Playground />

<Usage />

<Api />

<GlobalConfig />

<Examples />

### Default

<Example src="examples/default" />

### Name

To see all names click [here](https://www.htmlplus.io/element/animation/names).
<Example src="examples/name" />

### Duration

<Example src="examples/duration" />

### Easing

To see all easings click [here](https://github.com/htmlplus/ui/blob/main/src/elements/animation/animation.constants.ts).
<Example src="examples/easing" />

### Methods

<Example src="examples/methods" />

### Keyframes

<Example src="examples/keyframes" />

### Register A Custom Name

<Example src="examples/register-a-custom-name" />

### Button

<Example src="examples/button" />

### Intersection

<Example src="examples/intersection" />

<LastModified />
elements.title: Animation
elements.description: Creates an animation and applies it to the content. Powered by the [Web Animations API](https://mdn.io/web-animations-api). A wide range of animations is available [here](https://www.htmlplus.io/element/animation/names).

methods.name: done
methods.description: Hides the progress bar. If true is passed, the bar briefly appears before hiding.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Adjusts the progress of the bar, with the argument representing a value between `0` and `1`.

methods.name: trickle
methods.description: Increments the progress by a random amount based on the trickle rate.

properties.name: minimum
properties.description: Determines the minimum percentage used upon starting, which must be a value between `0.0` and `1.0`.

properties.name: trickleDisabled
properties.description: Turn off the automatic incrementing behavior by setting this to `true`.

properties.name: trickleRate
properties.description: The rate at which the progress bar increments when trickling.

properties.name: trickleSpeed
properties.description: Adjust how often to trickle/increment, in ms.

elements.readmeContent:
# Breadcrumb

Breadcrumb element is a navigation pattern that shows the actual path of the current page.
It represents the route using links, which enables the user to easily navigate upwards through
the hierarchy.

<Playground />

<GlobalConfig />

### With Icon

<Example src="examples/with-icon" />

### Custom Expander

<Example src="examples/custom-expander" />

### Customized

<Example src="examples/customized" />

<LastModified />

properties.name: accept

elements.readmeContent:
# Browse

Allows you to select file or files by using click or drag & drop functionality.

<Playground />

<Usage />

<Api />

<GlobalConfig />

<Examples />

### Default

Open the developer console.

<Example src="examples/default" />

### Disabled

<Example src="examples/disabled" />

### Multiple

<Example src="examples/multiple" />

### Accept

One or more [unique file type specifiers](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/file#unique_file_type_specifiers) describing file types to allow.

<Example src="examples/accept" />

### Min & Max

Choose between 3 and 5 files.

<Example src="examples/min-and-max" />

### Min & Max Size

Select a file with a size between 1MB and 5MB.

<Example src="examples/min-and-max-size" />

### Droppable

<Example src="examples/droppable" />

<LastModified />

properties.name: tile
properties.description: Use tile property to neutralize border-radius.

elements.readmeContent:
# Card

Cards contain content and actions about a single subject.

<Playground />

<Usage />

<Api />

<GlobalConfig />

<Examples />

### Default

<Example src="examples/default" />

### Elevation

The card element accepts a custom elevation between `1` and `24`. The elevation property specifies the value of the box-shodow property.
<Example src="examples/elevation" />

### Outlined

By default, the card element has no border. outlined property Adds border.
<Example src="examples/outlined" />

### Border Color

<Example src="examples/border-color" />

### Border Width

By default, the card element has no border. outlined property Adds border.
<Example src="examples/border-width" />

### Tile

By default, the card element has border-radius. The tile property neutralizes border-radius.
<Example src="examples/tile" />

### Background Color

<Example src="examples/background-color" />

### Customized

<Example src="examples/customized" />

<LastModified />

events.name: plusCrop
events.description: Fires when the `image` or the `viewport` is changed.

events.name: plusCropEnd
events.description: Fires when the `image` or the `viewport` changes are finished.

events.name: plusCropMove
events.description: Fires when the `image` or the `viewport` is changing.

events.name: plusCropStart
events.description: Fires when the `image` or the `viewport` starts to change.

events.name: plusReady
events.description: Fires when the image has been loaded and the element is ready for operation.

events.name: plusZoom
events.description: Fires when the element starts to `zoom in` or `zoom out`.

methods.name: move

parameters.description: Moving size (px) in the `horizontal` direction. Use `null` to ignore this.
parameters.name: offsetX

parameters.description: Moving size (px) in the `vertical` direction. Use `null` to ignore this.
parameters.name: offsetY

methods.description: Moves the canvas with relative offsets.

methods.name: moveTo

parameters.description: The `left` value of the canvas. Use `null` to ignore this.
parameters.name: x

parameters.description: The `top` value of the canvas. Use `null` to ignore this.
parameters.name: y

methods.description: Moves the canvas to an absolute point.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets the image and viewport to their initial states.

methods.name: rotate
methods.description: Rotates the image with a relative degree.

methods.name: rotateTo
methods.description: Rotates the image to an absolute degree.

methods.name: zoom
methods.description: Zooms the canvas with a relative ratio.

methods.name: zoomTo
methods.description: Zooms the canvas to an absolute ratio.

properties.name: area
properties.description: A number between 0 and 1. Specifies the automatic cropping area size.

properties.name: aspectRatio
properties.description: Specifies the initial aspect ratio of the viewport.

properties.name: background
properties.description: Shows the grid background of the container.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Disables the element functionality.

properties.name: guides
properties.description: Shows the dashed lines above the viewport.

properties.name: indicator
properties.description: Shows the center indicator above the viewport.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: Specifies the mode.

properties.name: resizer
properties.description: Enables to resize the viewport by dragging (Works when the value of the `mode` property is `crop`).

properties.name: resizerShape
properties.description: Specifies the shape of the resizer.

properties.name: responsive
properties.description: Re-renders when resizing the window.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: Specifies the shape of the viewport.

properties.name: src
properties.description: Specifies the image's src.

properties.name: transparent
properties.description: Hides the black modal above the image and under the viewport.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Gets/Sets data.

properties.name: view
properties.description: Specifies the view.

properties.name: zoomable
properties.description: Enables to zoom the image.

properties.name: zoomRatio
properties.description: Specifies zoom ratio when zooming the image by wheeling the mouse.

events.name: plusClose
events.description: When the dialog is going to hide

events.name: plusClosed
events.description: When the dialog is completely closed and its animation is completed.

events.name: plusOpen
events.description: When the dialog is going to show this event triggers

events.name: plusOpened
events.description: When the dialog is completely shown and its animation is completed.

tags.value: {Promise<boolean>} A Promise that resolves to `true` if the operation was successful or `false` if it was canceled.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: TODO

properties.name: connector
properties.description: This property helps you to attach which dialog toggler controls the dialog. It doesn't matter where the dialog toggler is. You can put the dialog's toggler inside or outside of the dialog. Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

properties.name: fullHeight
properties.description: Set the height of the dialog as much as the screen's height.

properties.name: fullWidth
properties.description: Set the width of the dialog as much as the screen's width.

properties.name: fullscreen
properties.description: Set both width and height of the dialog to occupy the screen size.

properties.name: keyboard
properties.description: Closes the dialog when `escape` key is pressed.

properties.name: open
properties.description: Control dialog to show or not.

properties.name: persistent
properties.description: It prevents the dialog from closing on clicking outside of the element.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: Specifies where to show the dialog box by choosing two values, one for horizontal and another for vertical. Horizontal has a range of `left`, `center`, `right`, `start`, `end`, and vertical values are `top`, `center` and `bottom`.

properties.name: scrollable
properties.description: It makes the user able to scroll the content by adding a scroll beside it.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Determine the width of the dialog.

properties.name: sticky
properties.description: Removes the margin around the dialog's content.

properties.name: transparent
properties.description: Deactivate the dialog's backdrop to show or not.

elements.readmeContent:
# Dialog

A dialog is a `conversation` between the system and the user. It is prompted when the system needs input from the user or to give the user urgent information concerning their current workflow.

<Playground />

<Usage />

<Api />

<GlobalConfig />

<Examples />

### Default

<Example src="examples/default" />

### Animation

elements.title: Dialog

properties.name: scrollable

properties.name: connector

events.description: When the drawer is completely closed and its animation is completed.

events.description: When the drawer is going to show this event triggers

properties.name: backdrop
properties.description: Activate the drawer's backdrop to show or not. It works when floating is activated.

properties.name: connector
properties.description: This property helps you to attach which drawer toggler controls the drawer. It doesn't matter where the drawer toggler is. You can put the drawer's toggler inside or outside of the drawer. Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

properties.name: floating
properties.description: On default the drawer is considered as a part of the main container. it pushes the other contents on opening. If true it will be opened over other contents and doesn't affect other contents. A floating drawer sits above its application and uses a backdrop to darken the background.

properties.name: mini
properties.description: Set the width of drawer to the minimum size you specified for the `mini-size` property.

properties.name: miniSize
properties.description: Sets the minimum width size of the drawer.

properties.name: open
properties.description: Control drawer to show or not.

properties.name: persistent
properties.description: If true, don't allow the drawer to be closed by clicking outside of the drawer. If false, the drawer will be closed by clicking outside of it.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: Specifies where the drawer will open.

properties.name: flexible
properties.description: It controls the flexibility of the drawer's width. If yes, the width of the drawer can be reduced. If false doesn't allow the width of the drawer to reduce.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Determine the width of the drawer.

properties.name: decimals
properties.description: Specifies the number of decimal places. Use an array to specify the minimum and maximum.

properties.name: separator
properties.description: Specifies the separator between number and unit.

properties.name: signed
properties.description: Shows plus sign for positive numbers. If the difference is exactly zero a space character will be prepended instead for better alignment.

properties.name: standard
properties.description: Specifies the standard of units. [Metric and IEC](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigabyte) are supported.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: Specifies the unit in which the result will be returned.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The bytes value to convert.

properties.name: alignContent
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows (It overrides alignItems).

properties.name: alignContentXs
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows for extra-small display sizes (It overrides alignItemsXs).

properties.name: alignContentSm
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows for small display sizes (It overrides alignItemsSm).

properties.name: alignContentMd
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows for medium display sizes (It overrides alignItemsMd).

properties.name: alignContentLg
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows for large display sizes (It overrides alignItemsLg).

properties.name: alignContentXl
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows for extra-large display sizes (It overrides alignItemsXl).

properties.name: alignContentXxl
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically across all rows for extra-extra-large display sizes (It overrides alignItemsXXl).

properties.name: alignItems
properties.description: Aligns contents vertically inside their own row.

properties.name: alignItemsXs

properties.name: reverse

properties.name: vertical

properties.description: Controls allowing the container to wrap the content or not if the cumulative width size of contents is more than the twelve-column width.

properties.name: wrapXxl

elements.readmeContent:
# Grid

It's the most flexible and powerful grid system which you need to build simple to complex responsive layouts, using two main elements, `plus-grid` as a container & `plus-grid-item`. By using these elements, align your content in any form & shape and for all screen sizes with 12 available column sizes and 6 breakpoints.

<Playground />

<Usage />

<Api />

<GlobalConfig />

<Examples />
### Default
<Example src="examples/default" />

### Auto Sizing

<Example src="examples/auto-sizing" />

### Gutter

<Example src="examples/gutter" />

### Gutter X

<Example src="examples/gutter-x" />

### Gutter Y

<Example src="examples/gutter-y" />

### Align Items

<Example src="examples/align-items" />

### Align Content

<Example src="examples/align-content" />

### Align Self

<Example src="examples/align-self" />

### Justify Content

<Example src="examples/justify-content" />

### Reverse

<Example src="examples/reverse" />

### Wrap

<Example src="examples/wrap" />

### Offset

<Example src="examples/offset" />

### Order

<Example src="examples/order" />

### Hide

<Example src="examples/hide" />

### Vertical

<Example src="examples/vertical" />

<LastModified />

elements.title: Grid
elements.description: It's the most flexible and powerful grid system which you need to build simple to complex responsive layouts, using two main elements, `plus-grid` as a container & `plus-grid-item`. By using these elements, align your content in any form & shape and for all screen sizes with 12 available column sizes and 6 breakpoints.

properties.name: alignSelf
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid). It overrides the align-items property of its parent.

properties.name: alignSelfXs
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for extra-small display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified. (It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for extra-small breakpoints).

properties.name: alignSelfSm
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for small display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified. (It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for small breakpoints).

properties.name: alignSelfMd
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for medium display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified. (It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for medium breakpoints).

properties.name: alignSelfLg
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for large display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified. (It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for large breakpoints).

properties.name: alignSelfXl
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for extra-large display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified. (It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for extra-large breakpoints).

properties.name: alignSelfXxl
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for extra-extra-large display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified. (It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for extra-extra-large breakpoints).

properties.name: xs
properties.description: Specifies the number of columns for extra-small viewports (portrait phones). It also determines the number of columns for bigger display sizes when other upper breakpoints (sm, md, lg, xl and xxl) are not specified.

properties.name: sm
properties.description: Specifies the number of columns for small viewports (landscape phones). It also determines the number of columns for bigger display sizes when other upper breakpoints (md, lg, xl and xxl) are not specified.

properties.name: md
properties.description: Specifies the number of columns for medium viewports (tablets). It also determines the number of columns for bigger display sizes when other upper breakpoints (lg, xl and xxl) are not specified.

properties.name: lg
properties.description: Specifies the number of columns for large viewports (desktop). It also determines the number of columns for bigger display sizes when the upper breakpoint (xl and xxl) is not specified.

properties.name: xl
properties.description: Specifies the number of columns for large viewports (large desktops). It also determines the number of columns for bigger display sizes when the upper breakpoint (xxl) is not specified.

properties.name: xxl
properties.description: Specifies the number of columns for extra-extra-large viewports (larger desktops).

properties.name: hideXs
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in extra-small display sizes (portrait phones).

properties.name: hideSm
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in small display sizes (landscape phones).

properties.name: hideMd
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in medium display sizes (tablets).

properties.name: hideLg
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in large display sizes (desktop).

properties.name: hideXl
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in extra-large display sizes (large desktops).

properties.name: hideXxl
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in extra-extra-large display sizes (larger desktops).

properties.name: hide
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in all display sizes.

properties.name: hideSmUp
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in small and larger display sizes.

properties.name: hideMdUp
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in medium and larger display sizes.

properties.name: hideLgUp
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in large and larger display sizes.

properties.name: hideXlUp
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in large and larger display sizes.

properties.name: hideSmDown
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in small and smaller display sizes.

properties.name: hideMdDown
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in medium and smaller display sizes.

properties.name: hideLgDown
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in large and smaller display sizes.

properties.name: hideXlDown
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in large and smaller display sizes.

properties.name: hideXxlDown
properties.description: Hides the grid-item in large and smaller display sizes.

properties.name: offsetXs
properties.description: Adds an offset space before the grid-item for extra-small display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.

properties.name: offsetSm
properties.description: Adds an offset space before the grid-item for small display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.

properties.name: offsetMd
properties.description: Adds an offset space before the grid-item for medium display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.

properties.name: offsetLg
properties.description: Adds an offset space before the grid-item for large display sizes. It also applies to the larger breakpoint (xl) while that is not specified.

properties.name: offsetXl
properties.description: Adds an offset space before the grid-item for extra-large display sizes.

properties.name: offsetXxl
properties.description: Adds an offset space before the grid-item for extra-extra-large display sizes.

properties.name: orderXs
properties.description: Overrides the default order of the grid-item for extra-small display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.

properties.name: orderSm
properties.description: Overrides the default order of the grid-item for small display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.

properties.name: orderMd
properties.description: Overrides the default order of the grid-item for medium display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified.

properties.name: orderLg
properties.description: Overrides the default order of the grid-item for large display sizes. It also applies to the larger breakpoint (xl) while that is not specified.

properties.name: orderXl
properties.description: Overrides the default order of the grid-item for extra-large display sizes.

properties.name: orderXxl
properties.description: Overrides the default order of the grid-item for extra-extra-large display sizes.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Specifies the color.

properties.name: flip
properties.description: Flips in `horizontal`, `vertical` or `both` directions.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Specifies an alternate description to use for assistive devices.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Specifies the name.

properties.name: resolver
properties.description: An asynchronous function to load SVG files.

properties.name: rotate
properties.description: Specifies the rotation.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Specifies the size.

elements.readmeContent:
# Icon

A graphical representation of an action, object, or idea that is used in a user interface to provide visual cues and improve the user experience. All icons are based on the popular [Bootstrap Icons](https://icons.getbootstrap.com) library.

<Playground />

<Usage />

<Api />

<GlobalConfig />

<Examples />

### Default

<Example src="examples/default" />

### Name

To see all names click [here](https://icons.getbootstrap.com).

<Example src="examples/name" />

### Size

### Size Overriding

<Example src="examples/size-overriding" />

### Wildcard Size

### Color

<Example src="examples/color" />

### Custom Color

<Example src="examples/custom-color" />

### Flip

<Example src="examples/flip" />

### Rotate

<Example src="examples/rotate" />

### Label

<Example src="examples/label" />

### Register A Custom Name

<Example src="examples/register-a-custom-name" />

### Animation

<Example src="examples/animation" />

### Resolver

Use `import`, `fetch` or any asynchronous function to load SVG files.

<Example src="examples/resolver" />

### Font Awesome

For more information click [here](https://fontawesome.com).

<Example src="examples/font-awesome" />

### Material

For more information click [here](https://fonts.google.com/icons).

<Example src="examples/material" />

### Multiple Library

<Example src="examples/multiple-library" />

<LastModified />
elements.title: Icon
elements.description: A graphical representation of an action, object, or idea that is used in a user interface to provide visual cues and improve the user experience. All icons are based on the popular [Bootstrap Icons](https://icons.getbootstrap.com) library.

events.name: plusChange
events.description: Fires When the browser detects that the element has been unveiled or obscured.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Disables the element functionality.

properties.name: once
properties.description: The event fires only once.

properties.name: root
properties.description: The element that is used as the viewport for checking visibility of the target. Must be the ancestor of the target. Defaults to the browser viewport if not specified or if `null`.

properties.name: rootMargin
properties.description: Margin around the root. Can have values similar to the CSS [margin](https://mdn.io/margin) property, e.g. `"10px 20px 30px 40px"` (top, right, bottom, left). The values can be percentages. This set of values serves to grow or shrink each side of the root element's bounding box before computing intersections. Defaults to all zeros.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: Either a single number or an array of numbers which indicate at what percentage of the target's visibility the observer's callback should be executed. If you only want to detect when visibility passes the 50% mark, you can use a value of 0.5. If you want the callback to run every time visibility passes another 25%, you would specify the array [0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1]. The default is 0 (meaning as soon as even one pixel is visible, the callback will be run). A value of 1.0 means that the threshold isn't considered passed until every pixel is visible.

elements.readmeContent:
# Intersection

The [Intersection Observer API](https://mdn.io/intersection-observer-api) provides a way to asynchronously observe changes in the intersection of a target element with an ancestor element or with a top-level document's [viewport](https://mdn.io/glossary-viewport).

<Playground />

<Usage />

<Api />

<GlobalConfig />

<Examples />

### Default

Observes the user's viewport to detect the visibility of the Card.
<Example src="examples/default" />

### Lazy Image

Loads the image after appearing in the user's viewport.
<Example src="examples/lazy-image" />

<LastModified />

elements.readmeContent:
# Scroll Detector

elements.title: Scroll Detector
elements.description: Detects scroll event from an element.

events.name: plusChange
events.description: Fires after the latest changes have occurred with a delay to prepare the value.

events.name: plusAfter
events.description: Fires after updating the stroke.

events.name: plusBefore
events.description: Fires before updating the stroke.

events.name: plusEnd
events.description: Fires after a stroke ends.

events.name: plusStart
events.description: Fires before a stroke starts.

methods.name: resize
methods.description: Syncs the canvas dimensions with the element dimensions.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: Specifies the background color.

properties.name: clearOnResize
properties.description: Clears the canvas after resizing.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Specifies the color of the strokes.

properties.name: distance
properties.description: Specifies the distance between the previous point and the next one.

properties.name: dotSize
properties.description: Specifies the radius of a single dot.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description: Specifies the maximum width of the strokes.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description: Specifies the minimum width of the strokes.

properties.name: resizable
properties.description: Observes the element dimensions to apply new changes on the canvas.

properties.name: throttle
properties.description: Specifies the time distance between the previous point and the next one.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Gets/Sets data.

properties.name: velocity
properties.description: Specifies the velocity based on the previous velocity.

properties.name: canvas
properties.description: The canvas element.

properties.name: redoable
properties.description: Specifies whether redo can be performed or not.

properties.name: undoable
properties.description: Specifies whether undo can be performed or not.

properties.name: reference
properties.description: Specifies the element to which the tooltip will be attached. Use `next` to attach to the next sibling. Use `parent` to attach to the parent. Use `previous` to attach to the previous sibling. Use a string to find an element to attach to that. Use an element to attach to that.
